channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report I-2024120044
item.description:
Report I-2024120044

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QSA GLOBAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/18/2024 at 13:40 pm, QSA Global, Inc. received an undeclared hazardous material shipment from Samsung Vietnam on behalf of Neadtech, JSC. The outer packaging was a shrink-wrapped cardboard box designed to contain a rice cooker. It was suspected that this package may contain a radioactive container. It was moved to the "Radioactive Shipping/Receiving" area of the facility. Upon opening the package, it was discovered that the package contained a modified Type A Model 650L source changer with a depleted Se-75 source (0.12 Ci). The rice cooker box did not contain the proper DOT required markings/labels for radioactive material or for an overpack. The Model 650L had no radiation labeling present, was painted red and the nameplate was not visible due to the paint. The paint mimicked the coloring of the rice cooker pictured on the outer packaging. Neadtech, JSC neither forwarded the 7 Day Advance Notification Form (F-C-3190-002) to QSA Global, Inc. as required for approval of an import of radioactive material, nor informed QSA Global, Inc. of the returning shipment. Radiation Surveys of the Model 650L were within regulatory limits, and no contamination was present. There was no release and no failure of the package other than the unlawful modification and incorrect shipment classification & labeling. Please note for ques. 25 on this form, there are no failure codes associated with RAM packages within the DOT Incident Form F 5800.1 instructions.

item.title: Report X-2025020155
item.description:
Report X-2025020155

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THERE, THE SORTER, NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. SHE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUBE. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. AEROSOLS, FLAMMABLE. INNER BOX MARKED WITH LTD QTY MARKING
